items.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley for Liberal Party leadership

items.title: New Zealand has refused to join Donald Trump's 'Board of Peace'. What about the rest of the world?
items.summary: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

items.title: FBI seizes Georgia ballots as Trump pursues 2020 election grievance
items.summary: Fulton County, which votes overwhelmingly Democratic, has been a target of President Donald Trump since he narrowly lost the 2020 presidential election in Georgia to Democrat Joe Biden.

items.title: Why your sunscreen application might be putting your good intentions to waste
items.summary: This is what three experts had to say about how to get the best protection from your sunscreen.

items.title: Fugees, Weezer, Spiderbait's classic albums turn 30 in 2026
items.summary: From Weezer's raw emotion to the Spice Girls's pop revolution, revisit 10 iconic albums that made 1996 a landmark year in music. Thirty years on, they still define the era.

items.title: Families frayed by NDIS cuts brace for more change ahead of defining 2026
items.summary: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: Charges laid after allegedly stolen vehicle crashes into Geelong school bus, officer opens fire
items.summary: A 37-year-old man and a 43-year-old woman have been charged after a dramatic incident that saw police open fire at a vehicle that allegedly drove at officers after crashing into a bus on Thursday afternoon.

items.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
items.summary: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: Government lands last-minute hospital funding deal with states

items.summary: Consumer advocates fear a rate hike when the RBA board meets next week could be the "straw that breaks the camel's back" for borrowers in mortgage stress.

items.summary: Ukrainians, including residents of the country's capital, are experiencing their toughest winter of the war as Russian attacks target electricity infrastructure.

items.summary: Celine Cremer went missing in 2023 from a track in a remote part of Tasmania's north-west. With several recent discoveries in the area, these are the theories of what could have happened.

items.summary: European Union foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says "repression cannot go unanswered" as the bloc looks set to categorise the IRGC alongside Islamic State and Al Qaeda.

items.summary: Donald Trump says he has struck a deal with Congressional Democrats to temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security, heading off a political brawl that seemed inevitable after the Senate voted down the latest package of government spending bills.

items.summary: The Australian Open will listen to complaints from players like Coco Gauff about behind-the-scenes cameras but remain convinced of their value, Tennis Australia chief executive Craig Tiley says.

items.title: Planning to breastfeed? Preparation can help you meet your goals

items.title: Most AI assistants are feminine — and it's fuelling dangerous stereotypes and abuse

items.title: Coalition chaos drags on ahead of first official sitting week
